chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:30 PM Defendant Adam M Swartz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kaitlin Elizabeth Dippolito appeared by video for Adam M Swartz.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 22CF225, 21CF338, 21CF314 & 21CF392
22CF225-Preliminary hearing
3:31 PM Jon Fick, patrol officer for Barron County Sheriff's Dept, called & sworn.  
Attorney Dippolito states DE waives preliminary hearing.
Court dismisses witness. 
Court performs colloquy.
The Court finds waiver, intelligently and voluntarily given.
Court finds probable cause and binds over.
Attorney Dippolito relates on bond modification motion to a high signature bond or low cash bond. 
State relates on bond modification.
Court relates on bond modification and denies motion to bond modification.
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

21CF314-Arraignment scheduled for 12/16/22 9:00 AM

21CF338-Hearing scheduled for 11/30/22 10:00 am before Judge Bitney.

21CF392-Hearing scheduled for 11/16/22 10:00 am before Judge Babler.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Kaitlin Dippolito appointed to represent the defendant.

10:20 AM Defendant Adam M Swartz appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Reporter appears by Zoom Video/Audio. 
COVERS 21CF314, 21CF338, 21CF392 & 22CF225.
Defendant relates he's been waiting for counsel to be appointed for months.  Case to be recalled. ** 10:27 a.m. Case recalled.  Attorney Rockow relates Attorney Dippolito will be taking these cases and will zoom in shortly.  Defendant relates, and requests bond be reinstated. 10:29 a.m. Attorney Dippolito and Defendant put in a break out room. Case to be recalled again. *** 10:36 a.m. case recalled.  Preliminary hearing requested in 22CF225 within 10 days and Court sets before Judge Boyle next week 11/02/2022 @ 3:30 p.m.   ALL FILES TO TRACK TO 11/02/2022 @ 3:30 P.M. BEFORE JUDGE BOYLE.  Bail continues.
Attorney Dippolito relates.

SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:03 PM Defendant Adam M Swartz appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Rockow appears by Zoom Video.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  This covers cases 22CF225, 21CF314, 21CF338, & 21CF392. Warrants are quashed in all files.  

22CF225 - DE to contact public defender to determine eligibility.  State requests $1,000.00 cash bond. Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond in 22CF225.  AIA set for 10/5/2022 at 10:00 AM before Judge Babler. 

21CF314, 21CF338, & 21CF392:  Bonds are reinstated. All cases to track to 10/5/2022 court date.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
